Documentation¶

BayesFactor¶

class bayes_factor.BayesFactor(dtypes)¶

Bases: object

This is the class used to calculate all bayes factors. In addition to methods for running each available test, this class also included a method for automatically infering the correct test to run based on data types.

Parameters

dtypes (dict) – Data types for each column in the dataset

ttest(data, y_field, x_field=None, mask=None)¶

Returns the Bayes factor for a t-test run on a given data frame for defined x and y columns. The column designated as the x should be able to be cast as a boolean indicating the two groups in a independent-sample t-test.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The dataset

  • y_field (str) – Column in the dataset whose means will be compared between groups

  • x_field (str) – Column in the dataset that will be used to distinguish between groups

  • mask (np.array, pd.Series) – Boolean array of length data.shape[0] that will be used to distinguish between groups if x_field is set to None

Returns

Bayes factor

Return type

float

anova(data, y_field, x_field)¶

Returns the Bayes factor for an ANOVA test run on a given data frame for defined x and y columns. Each unique value in the column designated as x will indicate a group in a one-way ANOVA.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The dataset

  • y_field (str) – Column in the dataset whose means will be compared between groups

  • x_field (str) – Column in the dataset that will be used to distinguish between groups

Returns

Bayes factor

Return type

float

regression(data, y_field, x_field)¶

Returns the Bayes factor for a regression test run on a given data frame for defined x and y columns. The x column and y column indicate the indepedent and dependent variable respectively.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The dataset

  • y_field (str) – Column in the dataset that will be used as the dependent variable

  • x_field (str) – Column in the dataset that will be used as the independent variable

Returns

Bayes factor

Return type

float

bayes_factor(data, y_field, x_field=None, mask=None, verbose=False)¶

Returns the Bayes factor for a test determined by the data types of the given x and y columns.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The dataset

  • y_field (str) – Column in the dataset that will be used to distinguish between groups or as the dependent variable

  • x_field (str) – Column in the dataset that will be used to compare means or as the independent variable

  • mask (np.array, pd.Series) – Boolean array of length data.shape[0] that will be used to distinguish between groups if x_field is set to None

  • verbose (bool) – Option to print messages

Returns

Bayes factor

Return type

float
